{{quote|[…] this meta-text is sometimes referred to as “'''fanon'''.” Within an individual fandom, certain plotlines may be reinvented so many times and by so many people—or alternately may be written so persuasively by a few writers—that they take on the status of fan-produced canon.<ref name=parrish>{{Cite web|articleurl=https://d-scholarship.pitt.edu/8963/|articlename= Inventing a Universe: Reading and Writing Internet Fan Fiction |author=Juli Parrish|website=Institutional Repository at the University of Pittsburgh|date=2007}}</ref>|}}
'''Fanon''' is a [[Wikipedia:portmanteau|portmanteau]] of "fan [[canon]]", referring to interpretations, explanations, or even subversions of fictional works that widely permeate a [[fandom]]. These can originate from [[fanfiction]], parodies, adaptations (such as the [[The Lord of the Rings (film series)|''The Lord of the Rings'' film series]]), or even misconceptions. Their permeation means their non-canonical nature is not always clear to fans.<ref name=parrish/><ref name=Eason>{{Cite web|articleurl=https://creativematter.skidmore.edu/eng_stu_schol/68/|articlename=No Canon We Die Like Men: The Oppositional Power of Fanon on Different Social Media Platforms
|author=Jamie Eason|website=Creative Matter: A Repository for Creative Thought at Scribner Library|date=2022}}</ref>

Examples of non-canonical concepts considered common in fanfiction by the TV Tropes community are, among others, the usage of terms like “dwarfling” and “elfling”, the notion of [[Elves]] being strictly vegetarian, and usage of modern military ranks.<ref>{{Cite web|articleurl=https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Fanon/TolkiensLegendarium|articlename=Tolkien's Legendarium » Fanon|website=TV Tropes}}</ref>

A major fanon undertaking in the ''Lord of the Rings'' fandom is the [https://notionclubarchives.fandom.com New Notion Club Archives], which is a project that seeks to weld together a coherent, denser and complexer [[Arda]], using concepts from various adaptations reinterpreted and adjusted for consistency.<ref>{{Cite web|articleurl=https://notionclubarchives.fandom.com/wiki/The_New_Notion_Club_Archives|articlename=About|website=New Notion Club Archives}}</ref> It, in turn, was used as a source for other fan projects such as ''[[The Lord of the Rings: Realms in Exile]]''.
